question: [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Field: gap_lookback_versions] [Range overflow] Can gap_lookback_versions + starting_version exceed u64::MAX, causing wraparound when calculating the gap detection range? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Field: enabled] [Validation bypass] Can enabled=false be used to bypass validation of clearly invalid configurations (empty postgres_uri, malformed addresses), hiding config errors until indexer is enabled? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: env_var_or_default()] [Type parsing] Can the generic FromStr implementation at line 218 fail silently for custom types, returning unexpected default values instead of proper error handling? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Function: env_var_or_default()] [Panic recovery] Can the panic at lines 220-226 be caught and handled gracefully, or will it always terminate the node initialization process? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Field: check_chain_id, starting_version] [Feature conflict] Can enabling check_chain_id=true with starting_version=0 cause the indexer to reject historical blocks from before chain ID was introduced, breaking reindexing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Field: skip_migrations, starting_version] [Migration conflict] Can skip_migrations=true combined with starting_version causing schema mismatches when reprocessing old transactions expecting different table structures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Field: emit_every] [Log spam] Can emit_every=1 cause the indexer to log after every single version, flooding logs and degrading disk I/O performance? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_config.rs] [Fields: batch_size, fetch_tasks, processor_tasks] [Task explosion] Can setting all three to maximum values create 65535 * 255 * 255 concurrent operations, exceeding system limits and crashing the indexer? (High)
